sentence: Universal Forest Products Inc.UFPI reported impressive bottom-line results for second-quarter 2015.
Earnings came in at $1.28 per share, roughly 6.7% above the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $1.20 and 18.5% above the year-ago tally of $1.08.
Better-than-expected earnings marked the company's third consecutive quarter of positive results.
The year-over-year improvement was driven by healthy performance in all end-markets, especially retail and industrial.
This was suitably complemented by lower cost of sales, which led to improved margins.
Revenue: Universal Forest Products' net sales were $838.2 million, reflecting growth of 8.5% over the year-ago quarter.
However, the top line came below the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $864 million.
Unit sales increased 10% year over year, driven by improved sales to industrial and retail customers.
These positives were, however, partially offset by a 12.6% year-over-year decline in average lumber prices .
Also, new product sales improved 22% year over year.
Total gross sales (net sales including sales allowances) were $850.8 million, up 8.5% year over year.

The company's three end market-based segments, namely, Retail Building Materials, Industrial, and Housing & Construction represented approximately 44.2%, 28.2% and 27.6% of total gross sales, respectively.

A brief snapshot of end-market sales has been provided below:

Retail Building Materials revenues were up 8% year over year to $376.2 million.
Industrial sales were recorded at $240.1 million, rising 17% year over year.
Sales in the Housing and Construction end-market were $234.6 million, up 1% year over year.
Margins: Universal Forest Products' margin profile in second quarter improved over the previous quarter.
As a percentage of revenues, cost of sales decreased 80 basis points (bps) to 86.6%.
This, coupled with an 8.5% rise in net sales, triggered an 80 bps year-over-year increase in gross margin.
Selling, general and administrative expenses stood at roughly $68.4 million, accounting for 8.2% of net sales.
Balance Sheet/Cash Flow: Exiting second-quarter 2015, Universal Forest Products had cash and cash equivalents of $24.8 million, slightly above $22.9 million recorded in the previous quarter.
Long-term debt decreased 34.6% sequentially to $122.3 million.
Also, in first-half 2015, the company generated approximately $36.8 million from its operating activities, up 61.5% from the year-ago comparable period.
Capital spent on purchase of property, plant and equipment totaled $27.8 million as against $20.1 million used in second-half 2014.
During the period, the company rewarded its shareholders with dividend payments of $8.1 million and bought back shares worth $0.08 million.
Outlook: For 2015, Universal Forest Products expects an improvement in the top line, backed by addition of new customers and products to its portfolio.
Also, enhancement of operating margin remains a prime area of focus.
With a market capitalization of $1.0 billion, Universal Forest Products carries a Zacks Rank #4 (Sell).
Impressive second-quarter results will likely boost investors' confidence in the stock, thereby, improving its investment value.
Currently, investors interested in the building products industry can consider better-ranked stocks.
These include Energy Focus, Inc. EFOI , Rayonier Inc. RYN and The Home Depot, Inc. HD , each holding a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
